title: Anna Quayle, Tony-winning actress best known on film for her roles in ‘A Hard Day’s Night’ and ‘Chitty Chitty Bang Bang’ – obituary
text:
Anna Quayle, who has died aged 86, thrilled early-1960s theatre audiences in London and New York when she starred as Evie and the other women in Anthony Newley’s life in the musical Stop the World – I Want to Get Off.

“Broadway’s new comedy queen,” enthused one American critic.

The subject-matter was breezily racy for the time, with Newley’s character Littlechap marrying his boss’s daughter (Anna Quayle) after she falls pregnant.

Then during business trips carrying on with Anya, a Russian hostess, Ilse, a German domestic help, and Ginnie, an American cabaret singer – all revue-sketch cameos brought to life by Anna Quayle, whom The Daily Telegraph’s Eric Shorter found “delightful”.

The musical,...
description: Anna Quayle, who has died aged 86, thrilled early-1960s theatre audiences in London and New York when she starred as Evie and the other women in Anthony Newley’s life in the musical Stop the World – I Want to Get Off.
